About Zoe
settings.content: Hand made, ethical & sustainable creams and skincare - find out more about the story behind my journey to help people all over the world rediscover their love for their skin.

settings.title: Fashion & Beauty Entrepreneur of the Year
settings.content: So this happened! Somewhere in between homeschooling the kids in a global pandemic and packing a million parcels I somehow managed to win two awards. It's  totally crazy to me because I still see myself as just a girl obsessed with nature, making creams in my kitchen but it's incredibly humbling to know that I've changed the lives (and the skin) of hundreds of thousands of people all over the world.

settings.title: Animals Rescued with Flori's Friends
settings.content: A percentage of each purchase goes to help dogs with life saving surgery

settings.title: Months making a difference
settings.content: Climate positive impact on our planet.

settings.title: Tree For Every Jar with Ecologi
settings.content: For every jar of Zoe Bee Cream we sell, we will plant 1 tree.

settings.title: Free UK Delivery
settings.content: On orders over £60

settings.title: Cruelty-Free Vegan Products
settings.content: Skincare That Actually Cares

settings.title: Personalised Advice
settings.content: Need help? Ask Zoe!

settings.title: Make a difference
settings.content: A percentage of every purchase is donated to Flori’s Friends

settings.title: have a question
settings.answer: You can contact us through our contact page! We will be happy to assist you.

settings.title: How long does it take for the creams to work?
settings.answer: It’s important to remember that everyone’s skin is different. Some people will notice an improvement immediately. But usually we would say it takes up to 6 weeks to notice a few improvements. Generally speaking, it takes about 28 days for skin cells to turn over, which means that almost all products require at least one month of use before you'll see results.

settings.title: do you have a recommended skincare regime?
Why am I breaking out?
settings.answer: Purging is when your skin is adjusting to the new product. Persevering with the product will help your skin to adjust and heal. The sudden crop of pimples actually means that it’s working as intended. As your skin is purging toxins, it’s important to remember to stick with it. This process can take 6-8 weeks. I recommend using a clay mask once a week to help speed up the healing process.

settings.title: What is the shelf life on all the products?
settings.answer: Zoe Bee Creams are preservative free. To keep creams at their best, we recommend storing them at room temperature. Once opened use within 12 months. Unopened the best before is 30 months

settings.title: Are your products cruelty free and vegan?
settings.answer: Yes 100%! The founder Zoe Bee herself is a huge animal lover, and this was incredibly important to her

settings.title: What is the best way to apply the cream?
settings.answer: The great thing about your Zoe Bee Cream is a little goes a long way. You only need a pea size amount. We recommend warming the cream through your hands and applying the cream to damp skin to lock in moisture. Work from your neck upwards.

settings.title: How do I use the Zoe Bee Scrub?
settings.answer: It’s messy but worth it. Apply in small amounts to damp skin. Massage for 2-3 minutes. If you leave on as a mask, you will get even more incredible results. The caffeine will wake up dull skin, and your skin will be as soft as silk

settings.title: I have oily skin; can I use these creams?
settings.answer: Zoe Bee creams work fantastically on all skin types. Oil dissolves oil so they help to balance your skin

settings.title: Are your products safe for pregnant or nursing mothers?
settings.answer: All products are safe for pregnant and nursing mothers to use except for the Zoe Bee Eyelash serum. This contains rosemary oil which isn’t recommended. Instead, we recommend treating yourself to a Zoe Bee cream to keep you feeling fabulous

settings.title: Are your products safe to use on children?
settings.answer: Zoe Bee creams are gentle enough to use even on new-born babies. The Charcoal and Oat cream is perfect

settings.title: I don’t know which cream is right for me
settings.answer:
The Charcoal and oat Cream and the Green cream are from our healing range. We suggest using the Charcoal and Oat cream to help with eczema and psoriasis and the Green cream to help with acne and scarring. 

The Gold Cream and the Avocado and Aloe are from our anti-aging range. We love the Gold cream for day time and the Avocado and Aloe at night. 

The Coffee and Walnut cream and the Veggie Souffle are from our skin tone range. The Veggie Souffle helps with pigmentation, rosacea and sun damage while the Coffee and Walnut helps with dark under eyes and dull skin.

settings.title: What is the difference between the rose quartz cream and the amethyst quartz cream and why do they have crystals?
settings.answer: You can charge crystals by placing them in a spot where they will receive direct moonlight or sunlight. The light will penetrate the crystal and fill it with positive energy. By then placing the charged crystal into your jar, the energy is absorbed into the cream. On their own, the creams have incredible healing power, but combined with a charged crystal you've got magic in a jar. The Amethyst Quartz helps those with insomnia and anxiety. It’s best used as a night cream. The Rose Quartz helps with those with low self-esteem and want to feel more confident. This cream is best used at night.

settings.title: what do the creams smell like?
settings.answer: The creams have a natural shea scent. Zoe don’t like to overpower the creams with essential oils to avoid irritating the skin. All the creams are lightly scented with sweet orange oil, apart from the coffee and walnut cream which has a natural coffee scent and the Amethyst Quartz Cream which is lightly scented with lavender

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.answer: All products are made to order in small batches by Zoe herself. Due to increasing demand, there can sometimes be a delay. All orders are sent via Royal Mail. When your order is on its way. We aim to get your parcel out within 1-3 weeks. You should receive updates from Royal Mail when it’s on its way. If you don’t receive a shipping notification after 10 working days, please email orders@zoebeebeauty.co.uk with your order number and your enquiry.

settings.content: 3 months results from using the Green Cream
3 days using the green cream and coffee and clay scrub
One day difference using the green cream
One day difference with the Charcoal and Oat Cream!

settings.text: What started out as a personal journey to understand what my skin was craving, has now turned into the monumental challenge of helping the world discover what their skin needs.

settings.title: Your story
settings.content: Add your own custom content to give more information about your store, availability details...

settings.title: In the beginning ...
settings.content: What started out as a personal journey to understand what her skin was craving, has now turned into the monumental challenge of helping the world rediscover the love story between themselves and their skin.

settings.title: The natural alternative ...
settings.content:
Zoe had always been interested in the natural alternative to everything so it was inevitable that she would find herself making natural skincare products for herself at an early age as an alternative to high street moisturisers that ultimately did more harm than good for her skin.

It quickly became clear to Zoe, that her natural beauty products helped in achieving beautifully glowing skin. Feeding skin with healthy ingredients allowed it to heal and flourish.

settings.title: We need natural & Cruelty free ......
settings.content:
It wasn't until years later when she had started writing beauty tips on social media did Zoe realise that there was a huge demand for a natural, cruelty free, vegan range of beauty products. Skin care that actually cares! Winding the clock a few years on, Zoe now supplies her creams, scrubs, balms and serums to happy customers across the world including a growing list of business.

Zoe has spent years honing her craft, ensuring every product in her skincare range is capable of exactly what it says on the jar. This includes, healing skin conditions like eczema, psoriasis and dry skin. Hydrating the skin while acting as a make-up primer, or literally making you sparkle. ❤️🌿

settings.intro-conetnt: Welcome to my new website. For those that don’t know me, I’m Zoe Bee founder of Zoe Bee Beauty. My passion is to help make a difference. That is why I have created an all-natural, nourishing skincare that actually cares. 8 years ago, I wanted to make something that helped my psoriasis. Fast forward to 2021 and I'm so happy to have helped so many people all over the world improve their skin confidence. I hope you find my new website a joy to be on and that together we can help you love the skin you're in.

settings.title: Flori's Friends Rescue
settings.content: Flori's Friends is a much needed lifeline for abused and neglected animals, offering them hope, alongside a happy, healthy and safe future, thanks to our amazing network of adopters and supporters.

settings.title: Ecologi
settings.content: I decided to partner with Ecologi to plant 1 tree for every product sold on the Zoe Bee Store to help protect our amazing environment around the world. Check out our forest by following the link below - you can donate additional trees to our forest to help our cause and watch our forest grow in real-time.

settings.intro-conetnt:
In this world of growing popularity in 'fixing' whatever it is we don't like about ourselves, it's become even more important to make sure you take care of what you already have and give your skin everything it needs to flourish.

After the birth of my daughter, I was really struggling with post natal depression. Luckily, my husband was really supportive, and when he noticed I was having a particularly tough day, he would send me upstairs with a cup of tea and run me a bath. These little breaks really helped me realise that taking at least an hour a week for self care is so important.

Those moments eventually turned into what is now called my weekly 'Beetox' which has been loved by many all over the world. An hour to de-stress, unwind and show yourself (and your skin) some love x

Water does not dissolve the natural oils or wastes coming from your pores. In science, “like dissolves like,” so oil is truly the only thing that will naturally dissolve oil!

The products we buy over the counter are usually loaded with harsh detergents that not only dissolve your oils/wastes, but also suck the living life out of your skin. The oil method is a lot gentler and equally as effective when it comes to cleansing. I use Jojoba oil as this oil is most similar to the skin's natural oils, so it's a lot lighter. Every evening, I massage my face with the oil for 2-3 minutes. I then rinse with a hot wet flannel and repeat the process. This is called double cleansing. After using the hot wet flannel, close pores with cold water. In the morning, I just splash my face with water and spritz my face with rose water which I recommend below, followed by a Zoe Bee cream.

You can also try dry oil cleansing. This method works best for dry skin types. Massage oil into your dry skin for 2-3 minutes. Rather than rinse with water, instead gently wipe away the oil with a dry flannel. Repeat this process twice. Try both methods and see which one works best for you.

I apply this mask once a week. This is my absolute favourite clay brand.  Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay deep cleanses skin pores, removing dirt and impurities, lifting out poisons and toxins stored in the epidermis; pimples and blackheads are absorbed into the clay bed, resulting in accelerated healing and nourishment of the skin. The skin is clean, refreshed, and alive. You can see and feel the difference. It comes as a powder, which you can mix with water, aloe vera water or apple cider vinegar.

settings.basic-text:
I usually use apple cider vinegar as this helps to balance your skin's PH. If the apple cider vinegar makes your eyes feel watery, then use water instead. You only need to use a small amount of powder, the pot lasts for up to a year. When it is applied to your skin, you feel it 'pulling.' This is because the mask pulls everything to the surface. When it has been rinsed off, you see and feel a massive difference. I use two wooden teaspoons of clay, slowly pour in the liquid and keep stirring till you have a smooth consistency. Your face may be slightly red afterwards but that will fade after 20 minutes. This mask is the ultimate skin 'reset' and helps to prepare skin for healing.

Top Tip: Try not to use a metal spoon as they affect the negatively charged ions in the clay while wood or bamboo do not.

settings.intro-conetnt: I like to use the exfoliating Coffee and Clay scrub twice a week. The molasses in the sugar are incredibly moisturising. The granules are not too harsh like store bought versions. The caffeine and jojoba oil is skin beautifying and reduces dark circles as it gets the blood flowing. This scrub also contains clay which draws out toxins. Check the Zoe Bee store to purchase a 200ml jar. This scrub can be used on both the face and the body. I recommend using it in the bath because once you get started, it can get quite messy. You can even leave on as a mask. Apply in small amounts to damp skin. Massage well, and leave on for up to ten minutes. This scrub smells amazing. We've been told it smells like Jaffa cakes, smarties, Christmas cake...try it and let me know what it reminds you of.

Most traditional toners can dry out, strip and irritate your skin. I like to get back to basics and keep it simple. Rose water is created by using a thousand year old method of distilling rose petals with steam. I love using rose water because of how multi-talented it is. Along with being anti-inflammatory, anti-bacterial and reducing redness, it's also a natural antiseptic, contains powerful antioxidants and even enhances the mood. There are two ways to use Rose Water. Firstly, you can spray directly onto your face and wipe away any residue with a cotton pad before applying your moisturiser.

Secondly, you can spritz your face, wait a few minutes before applying your moisturiser and then continue to spritz throughout the day for added hydration and freshness.

I've recently added an exfoliating peeling solution to my regime which I absolutely love. I use this once a fortnight. It does have a slight burning sensation which is totally normal for this product. I found the results to be amazing. Perfect for all skin types. This is an exfoliating solution which helps to reduce blemishes, even out skin-tone, lift blackheads and whiteheads and give your skin a better texture. You can choose to use this or the clay mask for an intense treat for your skin.

Every night, I use my favourite night cream, the Avocado and Aloe Cream, as an intense overnight treatment to work its magic while I sleep. The Avocado and Aloe has often been referred to as nature's Botox, and for good reason. The Aloe Vera increases collagen production, and is well known for firming and tightening skin. All the ingredients are known to help fight against wrinkles, dark circles, blemishes and scars. If you find you struggle with getting your beauty sleep, you can replace the Avocado and Aloe Cream for the Amethyst Quartz Cream. Click here to find out why this is a top pick for lovers of a good night's sleep.
Amethyst Quartz

Lastly, don't forget to apply your Zoe Bee Eyelash Serum overnight. It works by removing the build up and bacteria that's blocking the lash growth.
My daytime look is currently Rose Quartz Cream with some eyelash serum and that's all I need!

What started out as a personal journey to understand what her skin was craving, has now turned into the monumental challenge of helping the world rediscover the love story between themselves and their skin.

Zoe had always been interested in the natural alternative to everything so it was inevitable that she would find herself making natural skincare products for herself at an early age as an alternative to high street moisturisers that ultimately did more harm than good for her skin.

It quickly became clear to Zoe, that her natural beauty products helped in achieving beautifully glowing skin. Feeding skin with healthy ingredients allowed it to heal and flourish.

It wasn't until years later when she had started writing beauty tips on social media did Zoe realise that there was a huge demand for a natural, cruelty free, vegan range of beauty products. Skin care that actually cares! Winding the clock a few years on, Zoe now supplies her creams, scrubs, balms and serums to happy customers across the world including a growing list of business.

Zoe has spent years honing her craft, ensuring every product in her skincare range is capable of exactly what it says on the jar. This includes, healing skin conditions like eczema, psoriasis and dry skin. Hydrating the skin while acting as a make-up primer, or literally making you sparkle. ❤️🌿
